literal_meaning: To hit two flies with one stroke.
figurative_meaning: To achieve two goals with a single effort.
example: By attending the conference, he managed to network and learn new skills; he hit két legyet üt egy csapásra.

literal_meaning: Not all that glitters is gold.
example: That deal seemed great, but remember: nem minden arany, ami fénylik.

idiom: A kutya nem harapja meg a gazdáját
literal_meaning: The dog does not bite its owner.
figurative_meaning: Those close to you will not harm you.
example: You can trust him; a kutya nem harapja meg a gazdáját.
He led her kézen fogva through the busy streets.
After that mistake, he found himself in fekete leves.
After working all day, I’m fáradt vagyok mint a kutya.
I ran into my old friend in a different country; kicsi a világ.
We have többet mint elég food for everyone at the party.

idiom: Nem tudja a fától az erdőt
literal_meaning: Cannot see the forest for the trees.
figurative_meaning: Being unable to see the bigger picture.
example: He is so focused on details that nem tudja a fától az erdőt.
His speech was sokat mondani keveset; it left an impact.
